publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4043 Alex Neil: National Business Plan Competition—That the Parliament congratulates the teams of "Berry Scrumptious" from Robert Gordon University, "Paper Filament" from Glasgow School of Art and the University of Glasgow and "Incidental Kairos" from the Royal Scottish Academy of Music and Drama on their success as winners of the National Business Plan Competition which took place on Wednesday 1 March 2006 in Dundee; salutes their success against high-quality applicants from 14 other universities across Scotland; wishes them well as they begin to negotiate investment to grow their companies, and recognises the role played by the organisers, the Scottish Institute for Enterprise, in developing enterprise and business skills in Scottish higher education institutions.
S2M-4043 National Business Plan Competition (lodged on 1 March 2006) Michael Matheson*

S2M-4043 Alex Neil: National Business Plan Competition—That the Parliament congratulates the teams of "Berry Scrumptious" from Robert Gordon University, "Paper Filament" from Glasgow School of Art and the University of Glasgow and "Incidental Kairos" from the Royal Scottish Academy of Music and Drama on their success as winners of the National Business Plan Competition which took place on Wednesday 1 March 2006 in Dundee; salutes their success against high-quality applicants from 14 other universities across Scotland; wishes them well as they begin to negotiate investment to grow their companies, and recognises the role played by the organisers, the Scottish Institute for Enterprise, in developing enterprise and business skills in Scottish higher education institutions. Supported by: Michael Matheson
S2M-4043 National Business Plan Competition (lodged on 1 March 2006) Christine Grahame*
S2M-4043 National Business Plan Competition (lodged on 1 March 2006) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-4043 National Business Plan Competition (lodged on 1 March 2006) Linda Fabiani*
